title: Can India’s opposition win against the BJP?
description: India's opposition leader Rahul Gandhi is returning to politics after a conviction was overturned.

title: Shooter kills Tel Aviv policeman in Israel; suspect gunned down
description: Suspected shooter, believed to be from the Palestinian village of Jenin, was later killed by a responding officer.

title: ‘What is your business here?’: Iran equips navy with drones, missiles
description: Move comes after the US military said it may put armed guards on commercial ships sailing through the Strait of Hormuz.

title: Photos: Pakistan’s Imran Khan arrested after court convicts him
description: Ex-leader had long warned he would be arrested to prevent him from running in upcoming elections.

title: Pakistan’s general election may be delayed by new census
description: Decision by the Council of Common Interest to endorse the results of the latest census may cause a new political crisis.

title: Kuwait warns bilateral ties could sour over Lebanese minister’s comments
description: Lebanon caretaker Economy Minister Amin Salam had urged Kuwait to rebuild a part of Beirut's port destroyed in 2020.

title: Niger’s military rulers ask for help from Russian group Wagner
description: New military government seeks help from Wagner mercenaries against ECOWAS intervention, according to a report.

title: Pakistan’s ex-PM Imran Khan arrested: What you need to know
description: The cricket star-turned-politician was arrested after a court sentenced him to three years in prison.

title: Israel: Impunity comes home to roost
description: The political crisis in Israel is precipitated by decades of unconditional Western support for Israeli apartheid.

title: Why was Pakistan’s former Prime Minister Imran Khan arrested?
description: Pakistan's ex-PM Imran Khan arrested after court sentenced him to three years in jail for illegally selling state gifts.

title: France backs ECOWAS push to reverse Niger military coup
description: French Foreign Minister Catherine Colonna said the coup leaders in Niamey had until Sunday to hand back power.

title: Politics and polemics: What the coup in Niger tells us
description: A coup in Niger with Russia crouching on the sidelines. Plus, the Indian journalist blowing the whistle on the media.

title: Red-hot Japan trounce Norway 3-1 to reach Women’s World Cup quarter-finals
description: Japan dominate to win Women's World Cup last-16 match to set up quarter-final with holders the USA or Sweden.

title: Tracie Hall: What’s behind the rapid surge in book banning in the US?
description: The head of the American Library Association discusses whether the ‘land of the free’ will remain so for readers.

title: Saudi Arabia kicks off Ukraine talks that exclude Russia
description: Some 40 countries will attend a meeting in Jeddah to discuss a set of common principles to end the war in Ukraine.

title: Pakistan court sentences ex-PM Imran Khan to 3 years in prison
description: Khan's lawyer says the former prime minister has been arrested in Lahore.

title: Saudi Arabia urges its citizens to ‘immediately’ leave Lebanon
description: The Saudi embassy warned its citizens not to visit areas where armed clashes were taking place.

title: Chip war: Is there an end to tit-for-tat China-US trade restrictions?
description: We consider the impact as China's export curbs on the chipmaking metals gallium and germanium take effect.

title: Thai ex-PM Thaksin Shinawatra postpones return from self-exile
description: The former leader says he is delaying his return due to a medical appointment.

title: US approves first pill to treat postpartum depression
description: Zurzuvae is expected to be commercially available later this year.

title: Judge grants conditional freedom for son of Colombian president
description: Nicolas Petro has been released under the condition that he not leave Colombia or participate in political activities.

title: Russian tanker damaged in Ukrainian drone attack, state media says
description: Russia's Tass says the chemical tanker SIG received a hole in the engine room near the waterline in the attack.

title: India’s Kashmir clampdown continues four years after Article 370 abrogated
description: The 2019 move heralded a slew of policies by ruling BJP government to tighten New Delhi's grip over the disputed region.

title: US, UK scouts quit World Scout Jamboree campsite in Korea over extreme heat
description: Hundreds of participants in scouting event in South Korea's southwest have fallen ill due to soaring temperatures.

title: New York park descends into chaos as live streamer’s giveaway goes askew
description: Police arrest 65 people after Kai Cenat's giveaway event sees people climb on vehicles, hurl chairs and throw punches.

title: US pauses foreign assistance to Niger as it reiterates support for Bazoum
description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken says life-saving humanitarian and food assistance will continue.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 528
description: These are the main developments as the Russian invasion of Ukraine enters its 528th day.
